instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
Hello,

Ihave an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 that has green light, fan spin, but with no USB activity (apparently), that consumes about 500mA (starts normal arround 50mA and stops at arround 450 - 550 mA)  on the bench power supply, but seams to be dead. It doesn't do anything.

The client reports that he had water contact some years ago, and didn't work anymore since. Right now it dosen't shows any liquid damages (maybe it had ultra-sonic cleaning)

Where should i start? Witch rails should i check first? 

Cna you help me?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
You may need to remove J6100, if you don't need it to access SPI chip.
Also try known good working BIOS file; several links posted on the forum.

Do you get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
IÂ´m sorry, but can you please specify the  SPI Bus Series Termination resistors?

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

Thank you so much..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
Hello again.
My bios programer just died, and so I stole another BIOS from a donor board (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A).
Now, the laptop has other behavior: It consumes about 3A (starts at 50 mA and reaches 3A), the keyboard is responding (power on and power off at least), fan spin, cpu gets hot, fan keeps spinning on battery only, but it has no USB activity, no image (even on external monitor), and no chime. 

I don't know if it is processing anything or if it just has no image.

What should I check from here?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
You must discard BIOS issue trying known good working file.
There could be broken solders/traces, especially underneath BGA chips.
You should reball SMC.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
Hello,
I've flashed the BIOS with the new file, but no success. Same behavior.
After reballed the SMC, it became worst... now it has no green light and no fan spin. Drawing 0.24A on bench PS (I have 3.3V in <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>).
What should i do next? Can i mesure something to know if the SMC is damaged?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
Put original charger and check voltages and signals on the board.
Did you test for USB activity?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message: No USB activity, but assembled,  the keybord responds to the power on buttun, and SMC reset. It consumes about 3A, and the CPU gets hot..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
Looks like bad CPU now.
You can try to heat it until 180-200 degress, for 15-20s.
You may have luck to be only accumulated crap issue...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 dead
threads.message:
hi, i just realize that it has a long screw damage, just above the <CAPACITOR>C7648</CAPACITOR> (cooler heatsink screw hole).
Is there anyway to repair it (like on iphones) Where can i find the layer boards schematics, to try to jumper?
